intro: Phaeostoma, commonly known as the "twin-leaf fern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that often resemble the shape of a hand. The plants typically have a short, stocky rhizome with numerous adventitious roots. Phaeostoma species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and unique floral structures.
